org.loklak.api.amazon

Class SignedRequestsHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.loklak.api.amazon.SignedRequestsHelper

  • public class SignedRequestsHelper
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains all the logic for signing requests to the Amazon Product Advertising API.

        private static final java.lang.String REQUEST_METHOD

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static SignedRequestsHelper getInstance(java.lang.String endpoint,
                                               java.lang.String awsAccessKeyId,
                                               java.lang.String awsSecretKey,
                                               java.lang.String associatetag)
                                        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                                               java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException,
                                               java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException,
                                               java.security.InvalidKeyException
        You must provide the three values below to initialize the helper.
        Parameters:
        endpoint - Destination for the requests.
        awsAccessKeyId - Your AWS Access Key ID
        awsSecretKey - Your AWS Secret Key
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
        java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
        java.security.InvalidKeyException

      • sign

        public java.lang.String sign(java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> params)
        This method signs requests in hashmap form. It returns a URL that should be used to fetch the response. The URL returned should not be modified in any way, doing so will invalidate the signature and Amazon will reject the request.

      • sign

        public java.lang.String sign(java.lang.String queryString)
        This method signs requests in query-string form. It returns a URL that should be used to fetch the response. The URL returned should not be modified in any way, doing so will invalidate the signature and Amazon will reject the request.

      • hmac

        private java.lang.String hmac(java.lang.String stringToSign)
        Compute the HMAC.
        Parameters:
        stringToSign - String to compute the HMAC over.
        Returns:
        base64-encoded hmac value.

      • timestamp

        private java.lang.String timestamp()
        Generate a ISO-8601 format timestamp as required by Amazon.
        Returns:
        ISO-8601 format timestamp.

      • canonicalize

        private java.lang.String canonicalize(java.util.SortedMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> sortedParamMap)
        Canonicalize the query string as required by Amazon.
        Parameters:
        sortedParamMap - Parameter name-value pairs in lexicographical order.
        Returns:
        Canonical form of query string.

      • percentEncodeRfc3986

        private java.lang.String percentEncodeRfc3986(java.lang.String s)
        Percent-encode values according the RFC 3986. The built-in Java URLEncoder does not encode according to the RFC, so we make the extra replacements.
        Parameters:
        s - decoded string
        Returns:
        encoded string per RFC 3986

      • createParameterMap

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> createParameterMap(java.lang.String queryString)
        Takes a query string, separates the constituent name-value pairs and stores them in a hashmap.
        Parameters:
        queryString -
        Returns:
